artifact.content: Caller establishes a call by dialing a 4-digit extension
Phone manager verifies that the user�s IP exist
Depending on different cases, caller hears different tones
Callee receives call from caller
Conversation ends between caller and callee
A new user subscribes to the service and a new account is generated
User terminates the service
System calculates amount for each call
Bills are automatically generated to all subscribers
Warnings are sent to users who have an outstanding account
System must consist of a server and several phone subsystems
A graphical user interface is available to the Administrator
System must be able to monitor phone events as well as display system status information
System should have basic fault detection. If there is a system fault, it should notify the Administrator.
Administrator should have the ability to create new billing plan
System administrator must be able to resolve potential conflicts, view information and modify account information
Administrator should have the ability to test the system manually
Call connection response time must be quick
System console must be easy to learn and use
System must use minimal computing resources to perform tasks
Call failure frequency must be non-existent at all
System must be able to detect invalid input
System should be reusable on different platform
System should work with large number of users
System should easily extend new features
System design and components should be reusable
System should be easily modified
System should be easily verified for correctness
Design, architecture and code of the system are easy to learn
Level of interaction between modules should be clearly defined
